message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.MM

This paper deals with training Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) on datasets with noisy labels, which is a common problem in computer vision (CV) research. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a novel iterative learning framework that involves detecting noisy labels and learning deep discriminative features, which falls under the scope of machine learning (ML) research. Hence, cs.LG (Machine Learning) is the second most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the challenges of dealing with noisy labels and proposes a solution that involves designing a Siamese network and a reweighting module, which are techniques commonly used in artificial intelligence (AI) research. Therefore, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is the third most likely sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of web-search datasets, which involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques, and hence, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the fourth most likely sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with training CNNs, which is a common technique used in multimedia (MM) research, and hence, cs.MM (Multimedia) is the fifth most likely sub-category.
